snippet: The Obama administration’s aggressive focus on leaks has led to more than twice as many prosecutions as there were in all previous administrations combined.
abstract: Obama administration's aggressive focus on national security leaks has led to more than twice as many prosecutions as there were in all previous administrations combined; was prompted by review of four years preceding 2009 finding that of 153 cases referred to Justice Dept, not one led to an indictment; present and former officials say focus on leaks began at administration's highest levels and was driven by pressure from intelligence agencies and members of Congress.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration’s aggressive focus on leaks has led to more than twice as many prosecutions as there were in all previous administrations combined.

headline.main: Math Behind Leak Crackdown: 153 Cases, 4 Years, 0 Indictments
headline.print_headline: Math Behind Leak Crackdown: 153 Cases, 4 Years, 0 Indictments
